moves.1. e4: I stopped playing E4 because of the Sicilian, so lets see how this goes
moves.3... dxc3 4. Nxc3 Nc6 5. Nf3 e6 6. Bc4 N: White gets good value for the pawn, black is still good
moves.8... d6 9. Bg5 f6: I think f6 is a little weak
moves.12. Qb3 Qe8: White may play Na5 and I want to keep my white bishop
moves.13. Be2 Nd8: black retreats back, so white brings the rook onto the open file
moves.15... Rf8 16. h4: lets give black something to think about
moves.16... Kg8 17. h5 Ne5 18. h6 g6: Black has a really cramped position, white will strengthen the hold on the c file
moves.24... Rf8 25. Bf4 Kh8 26. Qd3 e5: This appears natural but it does further expose the black king
moves.27. Bd2 f5 28. Bb4 fxe4 29. Qxe4 d5: This is a very strange move and marks the beginning of the end
moves.35... Rxe8 36. Nf7#: The black white squared bishop and queen side rook never entered the fray, and white was able to use his pieces to greater effect
